bibl.title: Monuments of Christian Sinnuris (Fayyum, Egypt).
bibl.note: I. The Ancient Church of the Archangel Michael in Sinnuris. - II. Mary and the Angels: an Inscribed Stone Relief from Sinnuris [votive offering; ca. sixth-eighth century]. - Pp. 43-45: Appendix. The Old Altar-screen [with Arabic and Bohairic Coptic inscriptions; the screen bears no date but may likewise date to the eighteenth century].
bibl.seg: Peter Grossmann, Tomasz Derda & Jacques van der Vliet, Monuments of Christian Sinnuris (Fayyum, Egypt).
Eastern Christian Art 8 (2011) pp. 29-48, 6 figg. n./b. et coul., 3 plans.

I. The Ancient Church of the Archangel Michael in Sinnuris. - II. Mary and the Angels: an Inscribed Stone Relief from Sinnuris [votive offering; ca. sixth-eighth century]. - Pp. 43-45: Appendix. The Old Altar-screen [with Arabic and Bohairic Coptic inscriptions; the screen bears no date but may likewise date to the eighteenth century].
